Millions of People on Earth Live or Die:
 
 I'm sorry, but that's what I just heard on the local news.
 
 Warnings and warnings of an avian flu pandemic but the pharmaceutical industry finds it unprofitable to put money into something that happens only 100 years or so and reaps no profits.
 
 That's the Bush "Christian" values for ya!

post_info.post_title: Business Issues and Profits Determine Whether

Its more complicated than that, the phamceutical companies can make flu vaccines but they don't know which strain to make a vaccine for as the mutation that would allow the virus to become airborn rather than spread through feces hasn't happened. 
 
 They could make a massive stockpile now but it has a good chance of not doing any good, and governments don't want to spend billions on a mountain of vaccine that doesn't work.

Its more complicated than that, the phamceutical companies can make flu vaccines but they don't know which strain to make a vaccine for as the mutation that would allow the virus to become airborn rather than spread through feces hasn't happened. 
 
 They could make a massive stockpile now but it has a good chance of not doing any good, and governments don't want to spend billions on a mountain of vaccine that doesn't work.

 
 Using the now common seasonal flu vaccine taken annually by millions as an example, a few years ago my physician informed me he'd provide the shot if I wanted to waste my money but I should keep in mind it immunized against I believe he said around a dozen FDA approved strains while in excess of 100 strains were floating around at any one time. Knowing one's physician on a personal and professional basis is often to one's advantage. He called it bad Vegas odds against getting the flu but if I wanted what amounted to a part-time placebo he'd furnish same.

Vaccines in the middle of a pandemic aren't really the best things anyway, but no idea how much anti-viral drugs cost (though apparently 'people vital to the running of the country' or whatever have been given supplies here in the UK.)
